title: Marine Surprises Girlfriend on Snowy Doorstep to Pop the Question
text: Marine Surprises Girlfriend on Snowy Doorstep to Pop the Question By Eliza Murphy Jan 16, 2017, 2:46 PM ET 0 Shares WATCH Marine Surprises Girlfriend at Front Door to Pop the Question 0 Shares Email Marine Jon Trommer, adorned in his dress blues, surprised his girlfriend, Mandy Wehe, on the snow-covered doorstep of her parents’ home to pop the question. She had no idea he was home from being stationed at Marine Corps Air Station Miramar in California, let alone with a diamond ring. Katherine Anne Photography Jon Trommer, a Marine, surprised his girlfriend by popping the question on her snowy doorstep. “With my unit, we only get vacation or leave twice a year,” Trommer, 22, told ABC News . “They usually tell us a few months in advance.” He believed he would have time off to get home in January, but “then we got word from our command that we can come home earlier,” said Trommer. So he used the unexpected good news to his advantage for the surprise proposal. Katherine Anne Photography Jon Trommer, a Marine, surprised his girlfriend by popping the question on her snowy doorstep. “Her siblings and her parents knew, everyone except her,” he said. The lovebirds had arranged to have a Facetime date at noon, as they often do to appease their long-distance relationship. Katherine Anne Photography Jon Trommer, a Marine, surprised his girlfriend by popping the question on her snowy doorstep. “I wanted to make sure she was ready enough,” said Trommer, who had hired a professional photographer to capture the big moment. “I didn’t want to come to her house and have her not be there so I said, ‘For our Facetime date, let’s get dressed up really nice and do something fun,’ and she’s like, ‘OK.’” Katherine Anne Photography Jon Trommer, a Marine, surprised his girlfriend by popping the question on her snowy doorstep. He flew home the night before with the ring in his backpack, nervous to travel with it. As he arrived at her parents’ house in Parma, Ohio, Wehe, 29, almost didn’t open the door, but her sister insisted. Katherine Anne Photography Jon Trommer, a Marine, surprised his girlfriend by popping the question on her snowy doorstep. “She didn’t want to answer the door and of course her sister knows it’s me,” Trommer recalled. As Wehe locked eyes with her soon-to-be-groom, she got weak in the knees before running outside barefoot in the snow to reply, “Yes,” said Trommer. Katherine Anne Photography Jon Trommer, a Marine, surprised his girlfriend by popping the question on her snowy doorstep. “It went really smoothly,” a relieved Trommer said. “It was so hard to keep the secret from her.” Katherine Anne Photography Jon Trommer, a Marine, surprised his girlfriend by popping the question on her snowy doorstep. The happy couple plan to wed on Aug. 12 at American Wilderness Campground in Grafton, Ohio. 0 Shares
